Rohan R. Poojary

Data Scientist and ML + Theoretical Physicist

Home About Experience Projects Contact

Experience & Education

  • Prof. Shravan Hanasoge's Group (2025 –)
    • Data Scientist and Machine Learning Physicist.
    • Working on predicting Solar Wind features using Deep Learning Transformer models.
    • Analyzed and prepared raw radio Interplanetary Scintillation (IPS) data, NASA's OMNI data, and Sun spot data.
  • Le Wagon's Data Science and AI Bootcamp (2025)
    • 9-week, 9-hour intensive bootcamp.
    • Upskilled on industry-specific Data Science skills like FastAPI, Streamlit, Docker, MLFlow, Prefect, LLMs, HuggingFace, CI/CD, Agile methods, Git, and GitHub.
    • Developed and deployed a Bumblebee classification app and improved it further by employing YOLOv5.
  • IBISACAM (2024–2025)
    • Intensive German course from A2, B1 & B2.
    • Successfully obtained B2 ÖSD certification.
  • TU Wien, ITP (2023–2024)
    • Academic Visitor.
    • Worked on Machine Learning and Data Science methodologies employed in research.
    • Worked on simulations of stochastic dynamics and those used in Statistical and Mathematical Physics.
  • TU Wien, ITP (2020–2023)
    • Sr. Lise Meitner Fellow.
    • Undertook independent grant-funded research.
    • Studied chaotic dynamics of 4-dimensional and 5-dimensional rotating and charged black holes by analyzing mutual information of their boundary data.
    • Found further support for the previously discovered reformulation of the famous 'Chaos Bound' and uncovered its near-horizon dynamics.
  • Saha Institute of Nuclear Physics (2019–2020)
    • Research Associate.
    • Co-led research team studying out-of-time-ordered correlators and quantum mutual information in highly-interacting complex systems using dualities in quantum gravity theories.
  • Chennai Mathematical Institute (2018–2019)
    • Visiting Faculty.
    • Discovered further violation of the 'Chaos Bound' by studying boundary data of highly interacting plasma dual to a fundamental string extended in a gravitational spacetime.
    • Published internationally, co-led research teams, and co-supervised PhD students in projects.
  • Tata Institute of Fundamental Research (TIFR-DTP) (2015–2018)
    • Post-Doctoral Researcher.
    • Worked with Prof. Shiraz Minwalla, Prof. Gautam Mandal, and Prof. Spenta Wadia.
    • Studied bootstrapping methods for scattering matrices and developed general formulae for scattering amplitudes in String Theory.
    • Uncovered properties using Quantum Field Theoretic (QFT) techniques of highly interacting tensor models believed to exhibit black-hole-like chaotic properties.
    • Developed algorithms to compute highly complex physical quantities.
    • Independently discovered the violation of the famous 'Chaos Bound' suggested by Stephen Shenker, Douglas Stanford, and Juan Maldacena on black holes and similar highly interacting systems.
    • This was discovered for the case of rotating black holes in 3-dimensional AdS.
  • The Institute of Mathematical Sciences (IMSc.) (2009–2015)
    • PhD Researcher in Theoretical High-Energy Physics.
    • Studied String Theory and realizations of bulk-to-boundary AdS/CFT dualities.
    • Extended these dualities to include induced gravity theories by proposing new boundary conditions in AdS-3 since termed APS boundary conditions (Avery-Poojary-Suryanarayana).
    • Extensively used Mathematica, Python, Cadabra, and LaTeX.
    • Defended (Jul-2016) Thesis: Aspects of Holographic Induced Gravities.
  • Indian Institute of Technology - Kanpur (IIT-K) (2007–2009)
    • M.Sc. Physics, GPA 8.0.
    • M.Sc. Thesis in Experimental Physics: Electrical properties of metals at the nanoscale.
    • Secured Joint Entrance Screening Test (JEST) All India Rank-10.
  • University of Mumbai (2004–2007)
    • B.Sc. Physics, scored 76.87%.
    • Scored All India Rank-6 in the Joint Admission for Masters (JAM) conducted by the IIT group of institutes.
